intro: Cephalaria monocephala, commonly known as the single-headed cephalaria, is a herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and tubular flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers bloom in late summer, producing yellow disk flowers surrounded by white to pale pink ray florets. Cephalaria monocephala is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to temperate climates.
